question: Which economic measure of India recently surged to an all-time high of USD 493.48 billion?
explanation:
As per the recent notification of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), the foreign exchange reserves raised USD 3.43 billion to an all-time high of USD 493.48 billion.
The reserves announced were recorded in the week ended May 29, 2020. In the previous week, the forex reserves had raised to USD 490.44 billion. The major component of the overall reserves, foreign currency assets increased to USD 455.21 billion; gold reserves at 32.682 billion and Indiaâ€™s reserve position with the IMF at USD 4.16 billion.
